MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property SettingsActivity As String
public: property System::String ^ SettingsActivity { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Return the class name of an activity that provides a settings UI for the wallpaper.

remarks.para: Return the class name of an activity that provides a settings UI for the wallpaper. You can launch this activity be starting it with an android.content.Intent whose action is MAIN and with an explicit android.content.ComponentName composed of #getPackageName and the class name returned here.
null will be returned if there is no settings activity associated with the wallpaper.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property SettingsSliceUri As Uri
public: property Android::Net::Uri ^ SettingsSliceUri { Android::Net::Uri ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns an URI that provides a settings Slice for this wallpaper.

remarks.para: Returns an URI that provides a settings Slice for this wallpaper. The wallpaper should implement a SliceProvider associated with this URI. The system will display the Slice in the customization section while previewing the live wallpaper. Because this URI is accessible to other apps, it is recommended to protect it with the android.permission.BIND_WALLPAPER permission.
null will be returned if there is no settings Slice URI associated with the wallpaper.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool ShouldUseDefaultUnfoldTransition() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns whether this wallpaper should receive default zooming updates when the device changes its state (e.
Docs.returns: true if wallpaper should receive default device state change transition updates

remarks.para: Returns whether this wallpaper should receive default zooming updates when the device changes its state (e.g. when folding or unfolding a foldable device). If set to false the wallpaper will not receive zoom events when changing the device state, so it can implement its own transition instead.
This corresponds to the value android.R.styleable#Wallpaper_shouldUseDefaultUnfoldTransition in the XML description of the wallpaper.
The default value is true.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property ShowMetadataInPreview As Boolean
public: property bool ShowMetadataInPreview { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Queries whether any metadata should be shown when previewing the wallpaper.
Docs.value: Whether any metadata should be shown when previewing the wallpaper.

remarks.para: Queries whether any metadata should be shown when previewing the wallpaper. If this value is set to true, any component that shows a preview of this live wallpaper should also show accompanying information like #loadLabel, #loadDescription, #loadAuthor and #loadContextDescription(PackageManager), so the user gets to know further information about this wallpaper.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool SupportsMultipleDisplays() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns whether this wallpaper service can support multiple engines to render on each surface independently.
Docs.returns: true if multiple engines can render independently on each surface.

remarks.para: Returns whether this wallpaper service can support multiple engines to render on each surface independently. An example use case is a multi-display set-up where the wallpaper service can render surfaces to each of the connected displays.
This corresponds to the value android.R.styleable#Wallpaper_supportsMultipleDisplays in the XML description of the wallpaper.
The default value is false.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.
